abstract: Johnson & Johnson is acquiring Mentor Corporation, a maker of breast implants, for $1.07 billion in cash in a bid to strengthen its presence in aesthetic and reconstructive medicine.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson is acquiring Mentor Corporation, a maker of breast implants, for $1.07 billion in cash in a bid to strengthen its presence in aesthetic and reconstructive medicine.
lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical company Johnson & Johnson agreed on Monday to acquire the Mentor Corporation, the medical products supplier, for $1.07 billion in cash.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Buys Medical Device Maker
headline.print_headline: Johnson & Johnson Buys Medical Device Maker

abstract: Johnson & Johnson said Monday that it would buy Mentor Corporation, the maker of the MemoryGel breast implant, for $1.07 billion, as the health conglomerate makes its second cash-based acquisition in two weeks.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson said Monday that it would buy Mentor Corporation, the maker of the MemoryGel breast implant, for $1.07 billion, as the health conglomerate makes its second cash-based acquisition in two weeks.

headline.main: J&J in $1.1 Billion Deal for Breast Implant Maker
